query: Keeping Your Hands Warm With Citrus
keqe_expansions: Keeping your hands warm with citrus can be a clever and natural solution during colder months. Citrus fruits like oranges, lemons, and grapefruits are not only deliciously refreshing but can also be used to generate some warmth. By simply squeezing or rubbing the peel of a citrus fruit in your hands, you can benefit from the natural oils released that have a warming effect. The citrus scent can also be invigorating and uplifting, boosting your mood during chilly days. So next time you need a quick and easy way to warm up your hands, reach for a citrus fruit and enjoy the cozy sensation it provides.

Keeping your hands warm with citrus may seem unconventional, but it can be surprisingly effective in chilly weather. Citrus fruits, such as oranges and lemons, contain natural oils that can provide a warming sensation when rubbed on the skin. Simply slice a citrus fruit in half and gently massage your hands with the cut side. The friction and oils released from the fruit can help increase blood flow to your hands, keeping them toasty and comfortable. Additionally, the refreshing scent of citrus can uplift your mood and provide a sensory pick-me-up during colder days. Give this citrus hand-warming trick a try next time you need a quick and natural way to keep your hands cozy.

Diet and gallbladder cancer: a case-control study.	Cancer of the gallbladder is rare but fatal, and has an unusual geographic and demographic distribution. Gallstones and obesity have been suggested as possible risk factors. As diet is known to influence both these factors, we carried out the present study to evaluate the possible role of diet in gallbladder carcinogenesis. A case-control study involving 64 newly diagnosed cases of gallbladder cancer and 101 cases of gallstones was carried out. The dietary evaluation was carried out by the dietary recall method based on a preset questionnaire developed specifically for the present study, keeping in mind the common dietary habits prevailing in this part of the world.
